(44) 90.7th February, 1944.WAR CABINET.FUNCTIONS OF HIS MAJESTY'S REPRESENTATIVE WITH THEFRENCH COMMITTEE OF NATIONAL LIBERATION.Memorandum by the Prime Minister.I have approved the annexed Directive to Mr. Duff Cooper as His Majesty'representative with the French Committee of National Liberation^W. S. C.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,7th February, 1944.Mr. Duff Cooper, in addition to his duties as His Majesty's Representativewith the French Committee of National Liberation, is further charged with theresponsibility of informing the Supreme Commander-in-Chief, Mediterranean,of the views of His Majesty's Government on political and economic questions in which the French Committee of National Liberation is concerned or which relate to France generally. Mr. Duff Cooper will work in the closest contact with his United States colleague, establishing relations of complete co-operation and confidence with him in order that as far as possible identity of British and american views on French questions may be established. Mr. Duff Cooper willalso maintain close contact, both personally and officially, with the minister resident at Allied Force Headquarters, with the Minister Resident in theMiddle East and in questions affecting relations with the French authorities inthe Levant States with His Majesty's Minister. Beirut, and will arrange for the interchange of information with them regarding the questions in their respectivespheres in which they may be mutually concerned. -* The recognised abbreviation of this title, for use in telegraphic correspondence, is" AMB. ALO."
